business.headline: Waaree Energies IPO: GMP rises on final day, check subscription details Waaree Energies IPO: The grey market premium (GMP) for Waaree Energies suggests a potential listing gain of nearly 95%, with the company commanding a premium of Rs 1,415 in the unofficial market.

Explained: Why Coforge share price jumped 12% after Q2 results Coforge share price: The IT firm's stock gained sharply in early trade a day after it reported Q2FY25 financial results.
Zomato shares recover after falling 5% after Q2 results. Should you buy? Zomato share price: The early selloff was driven by mixed brokerage insights, despite an overall bullish outlook on the stock.

Paytm gets approval from National Payments Corporation to onboard new UPI usersThe approval is subject to adherence to all NPCI procedural guidelines and circulars, including guidelines and circulars issued specifically on risk management, brand guidelines for app and QR, multi-bank guidelines, among others.

Reliance-Disney merger approved, parties agree not to bundle cricket ad slotsA detailed order approving the mega media assets merger of Reliance Industries and Walt Disney was published by the Competition Commission of India on Tuesday.

IMF holds India's GDP growth steady at 7% for FY25, 6.5% for FY26The International Monetary Fund (IMF) suggests that the initial demand surge following the pandemic is now easing, with the economy returning to a more normal state.

Worried AI might replace you? This survey will change your mindThe latest findings from Adecco Group's 'Global Workforce of the Future 2024' report offer a contrasting view of how artificial intelligence (AI) is influencing workplaces, compared to common perceptions.

Not just smog but onions too will leave you teary-eyed this DiwaliOnions are currently selling for Rs 60-80 per kg in retail markets, and the impact of weather disruptions is likely to keep prices elevated.

Zomato Q2 results: Profit soars 389% to Rs 176 crore, revenue jumps 68%Zomato Q2 results: The strong bottom-line performance can be attributed to rising food delivery margins and the quick commerce segment, which is nearing break-even.
Sensex crashes over 900 points, Nifty drops below crucial support levelThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 930.55 points to end at 80,220.72, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 309 points to close at 24,472.10.

Stock market meltdown: Why Sensex tanked over 900 points todayStock market today: At the closing bell, Sensex plunged 930.55 points to 80,220.72, while the Nifty fell 309 points to 24,472.10. The sharp decline wiped out over Rs 9 lakh crore in the BSE's market capitalisation, leaving many investors reeling.

Has Adar Poonawalla hit bull's eye with Dharma Productions acquisition?Dharma Productions, established in 1976 by producer Yash Johar and now overseen by his son Karan Johar, has played a significant role in shaping Hindi cinema.

Opposition's charge against Sebi chief false: Government sourcesSerious allegations of conflict of interest and financial misconduct were levelled against the Sebi chief by US short-seller Hindenburg Research and the Congress party.

Ambuja Cement acquires Orient Cements for Rs 8,100 crore. Details here Ambuja Cement aims to increase its cement production capacity to 100 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) by FY25, with the acquisition adding about 30 MTPA to its total.

Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders share price down nearly 9%. Know whyMazagon Dock Shipbuilders stock price: Shares of the company were trading 8.52% lower at Rs 4,268.85 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 12:39 pm.

Paytm share price plunges 7% despite Q2 profit growth. Here's whyPaytm share price today: The digital payment firm's share price plunged sharply despite the company posting a net profit in the second quarter of the ongoing financial year.

Paytm showcases strong growth in revenue, delivers profit of Rs 930 crore in Q2Paytm Q2 results: The quarter also witnessed a steady rise in revenue and contribution profit, reflecting the success of Paytm's strategy of scaling payments and expanding its financial services offerings.

Hyundai Motor makes weak D-Street debut. Hold for long-term gains or sell now?Hyundai Motor India stock market listing: A long-term ride to profits or time for investors to hit the brakes after its lacklustre debut?

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Will take you to task: Supreme Court blasts Centre as Delhi air quality worsensDelhi pollution: The Centre assured the Supreme Court that rules would be finalised within 10 days and the Environmental Protection Act would be made fully operational.

Centre blasts X at meet over bomb threats to flights: Amounts to abetting crimeThe Centre came down heavily on the officials of X for not sharing the details of the suspicious accounts that were allegedly involved in issuing hoax bomb threats to airlines.

'Back to 2020 situation': Why China border deal is huge victory for IndiaIndia-China border latest news: China had maintained a dogged stance of not agreeing to India's status quo demand for four years, making the victory sweeter - not only diplomatically but militarily as well.

Supreme Court cancels tribunal order stopping insolvency process against Byju'sA three-bench headed by Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud directed that the settlement amount maintained in a separate escrow account pursuant to the stay of the NCLAT order, will have to be deposited into the escrow account of the Committee of Creditors.

Why Hasina letter mystery is fuelling a storm in BangladeshThe mystery over former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's resignation letter has fuelled a fresh storm in Bangladesh. Protesters are back on the streets and demanding the ouster of President Mohammed Shahabuddin. This is why Hasina's letter is important, and why Shahabuddin is in the crosshairs.

NCP releases first list for Maharashtra polls, Ajit Pawar to contest from BaramatiIn its first list, the NCP has shown confidence in 26 sitting MLAs, including ministers who sided with Ajit Pawar, when he led a political revolt against his uncle Sharat Pawar and joined the ruling Mahayuti alliance in Maharashtra.

Bengaluru collapse: 6 dead, some still trapped, building owner arrestedAn under-construction building collapsed in Bengaluru amid heavy rain in the city, in which six people died. While many were rescued, some were still trapped under the rubble. The police have arrested the owner of the building and filed a case of negligence against him.

PM Modi, China's XI arrive at Brics Summit venue, to hold bilateral at 4.30 pm Live UpdatesThis is PM Modi and Xi Jinping's first formal meeting in five years and also comes just days after India said it reached a truce with China to resume patrolling in disputed areas along the LAC in eastern Ladakh, ending a four-year military standoff.

How Hare Krishna movement survived brutal crackdown in RussiaRussian Iskcon members welcomed PM Narendra Modi in Kenzen with Hare Krishna bhajans. Once considered among the three "great threats" to the Soviet Union, along with pop music and Western culture, this is how the Hare Krishna movement has sustained in Russia.

Elevating Your Career with IIM Kozhikode's Advanced Operations Analytics and Supply Chain Management ProgrammeElevate your career with IIM Kozhikode's comprehensive programme, designed to equip professionals with the latest tools and strategies in operations management and data analytics. Gain hands-on experience through live sessions, capstone projects, and industry-relevant assignments, while accessing the prestigious IIMK Executive Alumni network.

Bangladesh tense as protesters storm President's residence, seek his resignationThe protesters have demanded President Mohammed Shahabuddin's removal for "lying" about deposed Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's resignation in August.

Happy hour begins now: Supreme Court rules states can tax industrial alcoholIn its 8:1 majority ruling, a nine-judge bench rejected the Centre's stand that any liquid containing alcohol not fit for human consumption but meant for industrial use will fall within the exclusive regulation regime of the Union.

Seema Sajdeh on post-divorce struggles with sons: Things didn't pan out…Seema Sajdeh talked about her relationship with her sons following her divorce from Sohail Khan. Her elder son Nirvaan disapproved of her move to Worli, prompting her return to Bandra.

Priyanka Gandhi marks political debut, signs her nomination for Wayanad bypolls LIVE UPDATESPriyanka Gandhi, along with her brother Rahul Gandhi and senior Congress leaders, will hold a roadshow before filing her nomination for the Wayanad bypolls.

Baba Siddique's shooters spoke to Lawrence Bishnoi's brother before attack: CopsAnmol Bishnoi was in contact with the accused from the US and Canada. He had also shared Zeeshan Siddique's image with the shooters through Snapchat.

LSG to release KL Rahul, retain Mayank Yadav ahead of auction: SourcesThe IPL franchise, Lucknow Super Giants, has reportedly decided to release captain KL Rahul ahead of the 2025 auction. Rahul, who has been with the team since its inception in 2022, led the franchise for three seasons, with two of those resulting in playoff qualification.

Manish Malhotra's Diwali party: Khushi-Vedang twin, Suhana Khan and others attendAce designer Manish Malhotra hosted a glitzy Diwali party on Tuesday, October 22. It was attended by Gen-Z stars including Suhana Khan, Ananya Panday, The Kapoor sisters, Orry, Vedang Raina and Sharvari Wagh, among others. Take a look at the pictures here.

Cyclone Dana to hit Odisha as severe storm in 2 days, relief teams on alert LIVE UPDATESCyclone Dana Update: At least 20 NDRF teams in Odisha and 14 teams in West Bengal are on standby and educational institutions have been shut, as Cyclone Dana will make landfall between Bhitarkanika Park and Dhamra Port in Odisha from the night of October 24 to the morning of October 25.

If you enjoyed Kanpur, have to endure Bengaluru 46-all out: Gautam GambhirIndia coach Gautam Gambhir defends the team's aggressive approach despite a loss to New Zealand in the Bengaluru Test. Gambhir emphasizes the importance of aiming for a win, even after being bowled out for 46 runs.

Muslim men can register more than one marriage, rules Bombay High CourtThe court was hearing an application filed by a Muslim man who sought to register his third marriage with a woman from Algeria in February 2023.

Amitabh Bachchan shares why he relies on his house help for online ordersAmitabh Bachchan shared his challenges with online shopping on the popular show Kaun Banega Crorepati 16. The Bollywood actor relies on his house help for his online orders.

Actor Suriya compares Kanguva to The Lord of the Rings, BraveheartTamil star Suriya opened up about his upcoming release, Kanguva, and compared it to Braveheart and The Lord of the Rings. The film releases in cinemas on November 14.

Viral: Shreya Ghoshal's rendition of Dhadak title track moves Badshah to tearsAt Geeta Kapur's request, Shreya Ghoshal delivered a heartfelt rendition of the Dhadak title track. In a widely shared video, Badshah can be seen visibly moved by the singer's performance.

Sookshmadarshini: Nazriya, Basil Joseph's film to release on November 22The newly unveiled motion poster for Sookshmadarshini, starring Basil Joseph and Nazriya Nazim, provides a glimpse into the film's enchanting universe, showcasing the captivating relationship between the lead characters.

sports.headline: RR set to retain Samson, Yashasvi, use RTM for Chahal: SourcesRajasthan Royals are preparing for IPL 2025 with plans of  retaining key players, including captain Sanju Samson, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Riyan Parag. Gambhir has instilled a "go for the win" attitude in his team, emphasizing an aggressive, result-oriented approach rather than settling for draws.

India aim for Olympics 2024 revenge against Germany as hockey returns to DelhiHockey makes a grand return to New Delhi with India set to face Germany in a 2-Test series after a decade. India will be aiming for revenge against Germany for their Olympics heartbreak in what is expected to be a thrilling series.

India squad for Australia likely on October 28: Will Pujara get another chance?The Indian cricket selectors are set to announce the squad for the Test series against Australia, with Cheteshwar Pujara's potential inclusion being a focal point. Despite not playing since last year, Pujara's recent domestic performance could secure him a spot.

Virat Kohli's MCG masterclass helps India down Pakistan in game for agesOn October 23, 2022, Virat Kohli delivered one of the most iconic performances in T20 World Cup history, leading India to an improbable four-wicket victory over arch-rivals Pakistan at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
